title: Azure DevOps MCP Server Authentication Issues
body:
Azure DevOps MCP servers require separate authentication configuration independent of Azure CLI (az devops) authentication.

**Current Status**:
- ✅ Azure CLI `az devops` commands work after `az login`
- ❌ Azure DevOps MCP server tools fail with identity materialization errors

**MCP Server Authentication Requirements**:
1. **Environment Variables**:
   ```powershell
   $env:AZDO_ORG_URL = "https://dev.azure.com/YOUR_ORG"
   $env:AZDO_PAT = "your_personal_access_token"
   ```

2. **Create Personal Access Token**:
   - Go to: https://dev.azure.com/YOUR_ORG/_usersSettings/tokens
   - Create token with scopes: Code (read), Project and team (read), Build (read)

**Common Error**:
```
Identity [ID] has not been materialized, please use interactive login over the browser first
```

**Root Cause**: MCP servers don't leverage Azure CLI authentication tokens and require explicit PAT configuration.

**Workaround**: Use Azure CLI (`az devops`) commands directly instead of MCP server tools when authentication is problematic.
semanticSummary: Azure DevOps MCP servers require separate authentication configuration independent of Azure CLI (az devops) authentication.
